newsitem.title: USA: HP, Netscape to Web-enable HP 9000.
newsitem.headline: HP, Netscape to Web-enable HP 9000.

text.p: Hewlett-Packard Co and Netscape Communications Corp said they will work together to include Netscape's Internet software on HP 9000 server and workstation products.

The companies said in a joint statement that every HP 9000 customer can therefore be equipped with Web server, authoring and browsing capabilities "right out of the box" through an expansion of the HP and Netscape relationship.

The companies said the HP 9000 Enterprise Server and HP 9000 workstations will be equipped with Netscape FastTrack Server software and Netscape Navigator Gold client software for the HP's HP-UX operating enviornment.
The Netscape server and client software products for the HP 9000 are available immediately from HP and can be downloaded over the World Wide Web.
Existing HP-UX customers with support contracts will not be charged for the Netscape FastTrack Server software, the companies said in a statement.
